page.title: 03WEETING VILLAGE 2
page.content: Despite the mix of the population there are several well supported clubs such as football, cricket and darts. The fine village hall is the venue for the W.I., art exhibitions and disco dances etc. The Bowls Club has its own green and pavilion. There are no med- ical facilities, the nearest being in Brandon and the nearest hospital in Bury St. Edmunds. There is no library but a mobile van calls regularly.There is a small local taxi service but as usual the public transport is poor.The nearest railway station is at Brandon, otherwise bus services are catered for by private local firms. The old school house by the green is supplemented by modern cabin classrooms for nursery and primary schooling, older pupils are bussed to Methwold.
